channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: ReCoMIF: Reading comprehension based multi-source information fusion network for Chinese spoken language understanding
item.description: It usually includes slot filling and intent detection (SFID) tasks aiming at semantic parsing of utterances.

item.title: Image Synthesis under Limited Data: A Survey and Taxonomy
item.description: Despite numerous efforts to enhance training stability and synthesis quality in the limited data scenarios, there is a lack of a systematic survey that provides 1) a clear problem definition, critical challenges, and taxonomy of various tasks; 2) an in-depth analysis on the pros, cons, and remain limitations of existing literature; as well as 3) a thorough discussion on the potential applications and future directions in the field of image synthesis under limited data.

item.title: Lightweight Super-Resolution Head for Human Pose Estimation
item.description: We first propose the SR head, which predicts heatmaps with a spatial resolution higher than the input feature maps (or even consistent with the input image) by super-resolution, to effectively reduce the quantization error and the dependence on further post-processing.

item.title: Graph Structure from Point Clouds: Geometric Attention is All You Need
item.description: The use of graph neural networks has produced significant advances in point cloud problems, such as those found in high energy physics.

item.title: Revisiting the Parameter Efficiency of Adapters from the Perspective of Precision Redundancy
item.description: Current state-of-the-art results in computer vision depend in part on fine-tuning large pre-trained vision models.

item.title: Contrastive Learning for API Aspect Analysis
item.description: For impact analysis, we performed empirical and developer study.

item.title: Conformal PID Control for Time Series Prediction
item.description: We study the problem of uncertainty quantification for time series prediction, with the goal of providing easy-to-use algorithms with formal guarantees.

item.title: Camoscio: an Italian Instruction-tuned LLaMA
item.description: In recent years Large Language Models (LLMs) have increased the state of the art on several natural language processing tasks.

item.title: Scaling Sentence Embeddings with Large Language Models
item.description: We also fine-tune LLMs with current contrastive learning approach, and the 2. 7B OPT model, incorporating our prompt-based method, surpasses the performance of 4. 8B ST5, achieving the new state-of-the-art results on STS tasks.

item.title: HAGRID: A Human-LLM Collaborative Dataset for Generative Information-Seeking with Attribution
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a new dataset, HAGRID (Human-in-the-loop Attributable Generative Retrieval for Information-seeking Dataset) for building end-to-end generative information-seeking models that are capable of retrieving candidate quotes and generating attributed explanations.

item.title: DDG-Net: Discriminability-Driven Graph Network for Weakly-supervised Temporal Action Localization
item.description: Considering this phenomenon, we propose Discriminability-Driven Graph Network (DDG-Net), which explicitly models ambiguous snippets and discriminative snippets with well-designed connections, preventing the transmission of ambiguous information and enhancing the discriminability of snippet-level representations.

item.title: Does fine-tuning GPT-3 with the OpenAI API leak personally-identifiable information?
item.description: In this work, we simulate a privacy attack on GPT-3 using OpenAI's fine-tuning API.

item.title: Causal-learn: Causal Discovery in Python
item.description: Causal discovery aims at revealing causal relations from observational data, which is a fundamental task in science and engineering.

item.title: Detecting Out-of-distribution Objects Using Neuron Activation Patterns
item.description: Object detection is essential to many perception algorithms used in modern robotics applications.

item.title: A Benchmark for Understanding Dialogue Safety in Mental Health Support
item.description: Our study reveals that ChatGPT struggles to detect safety categories with detailed safety definitions in a zero- and few-shot paradigm, whereas the fine-tuned model proves to be more suitable.

item.title: Domain Adaptation for Medical Image Segmentation using Transformation-Invariant Self-Training
item.description: However, the unreliability of pseudo labels can hinder the capability of self-training techniques to induce abstract representation from the unlabeled target dataset, especially in the case of large distribution gaps.

item.title: DiffProsody: Diffusion-based Latent Prosody Generation for Expressive Speech Synthesis with Prosody Conditional Adversarial Training
item.description: Expressive text-to-speech systems have undergone significant advancements owing to prosody modeling, but conventional methods can still be improved.

item.title: Classifying multilingual party manifestos: Domain transfer across country, time, and genre
item.description: We explore the potential of domain transfer across geographical locations, languages, time, and genre in a large-scale database of political manifestos.

item.title: High Dynamic Range Image Reconstruction via Deep Explicit Polynomial Curve Estimation
item.description: Besides, since all current datasets do not provide the corresponding relationship between the tone mapping function and the LDR image, we construct a new dataset with both synthetic and real images.

item.title: Transferable Attack for Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Semantic segmentation models are known vulnerable to small input perturbations.

item.title: VacancySBERT: the approach for representation of titles and skills for semantic similarity search in the recruitment domain
item.description: In this article semantic similarity search to find candidates for title normalization has been used.

item.title: ToolLLM: Facilitating Large Language Models to Master 16000+ Real-world APIs
item.description: We first present ToolBench, an instruction-tuning dataset for tool use, which is created automatically using ChatGPT.

item.title: UniVTG: Towards Unified Video-Language Temporal Grounding
item.description: Most methods in this direction develop taskspecific models that are trained with type-specific labels, such as moment retrieval (time interval) and highlight detection (worthiness curve), which limits their abilities to generalize to various VTG tasks and labels.

item.title: Benchmarking and Analyzing Robust Point Cloud Recognition: Bag of Tricks for Defending Adversarial Examples
item.description: In this paper, we first establish a comprehensive, and rigorous point cloud adversarial robustness benchmark to evaluate adversarial robustness, which can provide a detailed understanding of the effects of the defense and attack methods.

item.title: JOTR: 3D Joint Contrastive Learning with Transformers for Occluded Human Mesh Recovery
item.description: Our method includes an encoder-decoder transformer architecture to fuse 2D and 3D representations for achieving 2D$\&$3D aligned results in a coarse-to-fine manner and a novel 3D joint contrastive learning approach for adding explicitly global supervision for the 3D feature space.

item.title: Rethinking Collaborative Perception from the Spatial-Temporal Importance of Semantic Information
item.description: However, existing collaborative perception methods tend to focus solely on the spatial features of semantic information, while neglecting the importance of the temporal dimension in collaborator selection and semantic information fusion, which instigates performance degradation.

item.title: Random Sub-Samples Generation for Self-Supervised Real Image Denoising
item.description: With sufficient paired training samples, the supervised deep learning methods have attracted much attention in image denoising because of their superior performance.

item.title: Value-Informed Skill Chaining for Policy Learning of Long-Horizon Tasks with Surgical Robot
item.description: Based on this value function, a chaining policy is learned to instruct subtask policies to terminate at the state with the highest value so that all subsequent policies are more likely to be connected for accomplishing the task.

item.title: BearingPGA-Net: A Lightweight and Deployable Bearing Fault Diagnosis Network via Decoupled Knowledge Distillation and FPGA Acceleration
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, this is the first instance of deploying a CNN-based bearing fault diagnosis model on an FPGA.

item.title: RCS-YOLO: A Fast and High-Accuracy Object Detector for Brain Tumor Detection
item.description: With an excellent balance between speed and accuracy, cutting-edge YOLO frameworks have become one of the most efficient algorithms for object detection.

item.title: Subspace Distillation for Continual Learning
item.description: To mitigate forgetting prior knowledge, we propose a novel knowledge distillation technique that takes into the account the manifold structure of the latent/output space of a neural network in learning novel tasks.

item.title: L3DMC: Lifelong Learning using Distillation via Mixed-Curvature Space
item.description: To address the problem, we propose a distillation strategy named L3DMC that operates on mixed-curvature spaces to preserve the already-learned knowledge by modeling and maintaining complex geometrical structures.

item.title: Unsupervised Decomposition Networks for Bias Field Correction in MR Image
item.description: Many retrospective algorithms were developed to facilitate the bias correction, to which the deep learning-based methods outperformed.

item.title: StarSRGAN: Improving Real-World Blind Super-Resolution
item.description: The aim of blind super-resolution (SR) in computer vision is to improve the resolution of an image without prior knowledge of the degradation process that caused the image to be low-resolution.

item.title: Structure-Preserving Synthesis: MaskGAN for Unpaired MR-CT Translation
item.description: Extensive experiments demonstrate that MaskGAN outperforms state-of-the-art synthesis methods on a challenging pediatric dataset, where MR and CT scans are heavily misaligned due to rapid growth in children.

item.title: Augmented Math: Authoring AR-Based Explorable Explanations by Augmenting Static Math Textbooks
item.description: This empowers non-technical users, such as teachers or students, to transform existing math textbooks and handouts into on-demand and personalized explorable explanations.

item.title: Do LLMs Possess a Personality? Making the MBTI Test an Amazing Evaluation for Large Language Models
item.description: The field of large language models (LLMs) has made significant progress, and their knowledge storage capacity is approaching that of human beings.

item.title: Predicting delays in Indian lower courts using AutoML and Decision Forests
item.description: This paper presents a classification model that predicts delays in Indian lower courts based on case information available at filing.

item.title: A Knowledge-enhanced Two-stage Generative Framework for Medical Dialogue Information Extraction
item.description: However, these generative methods output a whole sequence consisting of term-status pairs in one stage and ignore integrating prior knowledge, which demands a deeper understanding to model the relationship between terms and infer the status of each term.

item.title: Mesh Density Adaptation for Template-based Shape Reconstruction
item.description: In 3D shape reconstruction based on template mesh deformation, a regularization, such as smoothness energy, is employed to guide the reconstruction into a desirable direction.

item.title: Rethinking Uncertainly Missing and Ambiguous Visual Modality in Multi-Modal Entity Alignment
item.description: As a crucial extension of entity alignment (EA), multi-modal entity alignment (MMEA) aims to identify identical entities across disparate knowledge graphs (KGs) by exploiting associated visual information.

item.title: SEED-Bench: Benchmarking Multimodal LLMs with Generative Comprehension
item.description: Based on powerful Large Language Models (LLMs), recent generative Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) have gained prominence as a pivotal research area, exhibiting remarkable capability for both comprehension and generation.

item.title: Implicit Neural Representation in Medical Imaging: A Comparative Survey
item.description: Recognizing the potential of INRs beyond these domains, this survey aims to provide a comprehensive overview of INR models in the field of medical imaging.

item.title: Synthesizing Event-centric Knowledge Graphs of Daily Activities Using Virtual Space
item.description: Artificial intelligence (AI) is expected to be embodied in software agents, robots, and cyber-physical systems that can understand the various contextual information of daily life in the home environment to support human behavior and decision making in various situations.

item.title: Unified Model for Image, Video, Audio and Language Tasks
item.description: Our model is efficiently pretrained on many tasks, based on task balancing and multimodal curriculum learning.

item.title: RoseNNa: A performant, portable library for neural network inference with application to computational fluid dynamics
item.description: RoseNNa is a non-invasive, lightweight (1000 lines), and performant tool for neural network inference, with focus on the smaller networks used to augment PDE solvers, like those of CFD, which are typically written in C/C++ or Fortran.

item.title: Robust Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning with State Uncertainty
item.description: Then we propose a robust multi-agent Q-learning (RMAQ) algorithm to find such an equilibrium, with convergence guarantees.

item.title: Improving TTS for Shanghainese: Addressing Tone Sandhi via Word Segmentation
item.description: Tone is a crucial component of the prosody of Shanghainese, a Wu Chinese variety spoken primarily in urban Shanghai.

item.title: Deep Unrolling Networks with Recurrent Momentum Acceleration for Nonlinear Inverse Problems
item.description: We provide experimental results on two nonlinear inverse problems: a nonlinear deconvolution problem, and an electrical impedance tomography problem with limited boundary measurements.

item.title: Variance Control for Distributional Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Although distributional reinforcement learning (DRL) has been widely examined in the past few years, very few studies investigate the validity of the obtained Q-function estimator in the distributional setting.
